function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Air cleaning and disinfection devices may be beneficial in environments with poor ventilation.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of infectious viruses due to air recirculation in public buildings","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of filters in removing small particles associated with adverse health effects","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Modification of hvac control strategies may not be straightforward and could lead to unintended consequences for temperature, humidity, and air flow distribution.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Customization of ventilation systems can introduce new design vulnerabilities and potential failure points, increasing the risk of airborne disease transmission.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on natural ventilation methods may result in inconsistent and unreliable outdoor air flow rates, leading to varying levels of ventilation effectiveness.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in public buildings and shared spaces","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Survival of airborne pathogens in indoor environments","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Returning to inadequately ventilated workplaces and public buildings","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Local barriers to ventilation due to partitions or drawn curtains","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitations in increasing ventilation rates during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to high concentration of virus-laden air","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate distribution of ventilation leading to inadequate dilution of contaminated air","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of recommendations and engineering controls to reduce the potential airborne transmission of sars-cov-2 and other airborne viruses.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of contagious diseases such as tuberculosis, measles, chickenpox, sars-cov, mers-cov, rsv, and influenza.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Viral loads found in personal samplers worn by the sampling team when in the presence of a patient receiving oxygen via nasal cannula, indicating potential airborne transmission.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential airborne transmission of sars-cov-2","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Viral rna presence in air samples","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of preparedness for unexpected major disruptions in the supply chain","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exploratory studies may not identify all potential drivers of contagious diseases in the built environment","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Prescriptive view may not effectively optimize resources for disease mitigation in the built environment","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Predictive approaches may not accurately anticipate the future impact and likelihood of contagious diseases in the built environment","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Disruptions in production due to decreasing availability of essential raw materials and staff","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility in supply chain network design","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Non-collaborative structures in supply chain","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Covid-19 outbreak and its impact on supply chains","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of focus on nox-, sox-related emissions and particle matter","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Neglect of closed-loop supply chains and circular economy models in certain sectors","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Disruptions from outbreaks and other major external events","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation due to lack of health measures","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Environmental impact leading to resource depletion and waste generation","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for major external disruptions within the supply chain","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate performance evaluation for long-term sustainability","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"A wider spread disruption such as a continental-wide pandemic could impact a variety of locations and stakeholders.","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Characteristics of the supply chain, including logistic operations, network structure, dynamics, and complexity, determine the way major external disruptions may change performance within the supply chain.","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in global and local supply chains","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Volatile economic situations affecting manufacturing and logistics sectors","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of agility, adaptability, and alignment in supply chains","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global disruptions impacting supply chains at operational, tactical, and strategic levels","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to measure long-term sustainability and performance in supply chains","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of supply chain structure specification","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of supply chain structure and organization may create vulnerabilities to contagious disease propagation within the network.","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fragility of global supply network exposed by covid-19 outbreaks","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of supply chain resilience and reach in operations","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disruptions and closure of different sectors, including farms, production plants, logistics facilities, and transportation, is unprecedented worldwide.","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High levels of uncertainty and instability in global supply chains","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proper models for sustainable and effective distribution strategies","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Complexity of the supply chain due to globalisation","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Public places may become hotspots for disease transmission if ventilation rates are not maximized","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate scheduling and population distribution patterns in buildings may lead to increased infection risk","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"}]}
